alert.note: Alert for Eastern Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 4:09PM AKST until December 22 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST FRIDAY FOR THE EASTERN ALEUTIANS... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Visibility of one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians, including the communities of Nikolski, Unalaska, and Akutan. * WHEN...From noon today to noon AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light to moderate snow and blowing snow are expected as a front moves west to east across the Eastern Aleutians. Temperatures warmed into the mid 30s Thursday afternoon, thus the onset of snow and blowing will be delayed until later tonight when temperatures begin to fall again. Confidence continues to be lower for snow amounts and whether snow will be transportable enough to significantly reduce visibility, especially near sea level.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
